LOS 54.6
Parties to a securitization are a seller of financial assets, a special purpose entity (SPE),
and a servicer.
• The seller is the firm that is raising funds through the securitization.
An SPE is an entity independent of the seller. The SPE buys financial assets from the
seller and issues asset-backed securities (ABS) supported by these financial assets.
The servicer carries out collections and other responsibilities related to the financial
assets. The servicer may be the same entity as the seller but does not have to be.
The SPE may issue a single class of ABS or multiple classes with different priorities of
claims to cash flows from the pool of financial assets.
